companies.name: Tippstr
companies.blurb:
As Lead Developer: 
Researched and prototyped several frameworks suitable to the project before selecting Angular 1.x 
Wrote wiki guidelines and presented walkthroughs for other members of the team (and other teams)
Established naming conventions for files, types, directories, etc. and defined guidelines for common scenarios e.g. use of strict mode, avoiding global variables, templates for tests. 
Set up Grunt task management for running code updates, running lints, running tests, reports and deployment to multiple environments 
Combined Protractor and Cucumber (I later dropped Cucumber and followed practices adopted by the Google Angular team) 
Steadily reduced the use of controllers in anticipation of Angular 2 (and because they encourage lazy coding) 
Implemented support for versioning (language and currency) 
Completed 3 version updates for Angular (and dependencies including the move to Bootstrap 3) 
Created bespoke functions for business-specific logic and common utilities 
Created templates for common page types (services, controllers, directives, etc) to speed up development and encourage and hone good practices and patterns 
Trialled generators (but found them too cumbersome) 
Created dedicated APIs for the core business types (we were able to adapt quickly to changes on the server API) and core business types (prototypes) 

As Team Leader: 
Put in place a TDD approach. The team wrote 500+ unit tests and 500+ functional tests (Jasmine, ngScenario, Karma, Cucumber and Protractor) 
Oversaw the addition of D3 charts for visual representation 
Interviewed candidates 
Encouraged developers to challenge existing practices 
Encouraged developers to take on more responsibility and to speak out (and lead) team meetings (standups) 

As Project Manager: 
Revised and updated schedules for all project applications (JIRA) 
Reviewed state of play and projections with team members across all applications 
Led scrums 
Prepared documentation for potential investors

companies.name: Seatwave | Ticketmaster
companies.blurb:
During this period I moved from working on backend development to frontend development. I started on the project in London and then worked remotely from Barcelona for about one year. 
Together with the Architect created a specification for the API which we built in tandem 
Created Service and Repository layers and introduced DI (and potentially testing) as part of a site-wide review of our architecture 
Built client-side mobile version of the site using the new API and native JavaScript and jQuery. Within days this site was handling a high volume of transactions 
Once the new pattern and API were proven the main site moved to use this refactored version

companies.name: Enteraction
companies.blurb:
Member of the exceptional team which helped Seatwave become the leading secondary ticket exchange in Europe. Seatwave was recently named the number one Tech Media 100 Company for 2009. 
Together with the architect, designers and UI specialists created and evolved an extensible, multi-language framework. 
Collaborated with the senior designer on the specification and implementation of a flexible architecture for a variety of co-branded versions of the site for clients including MSN and Virgin Media. 
Worked with the Marketing Director to develop an extensive affiliate programme. 
Worked with the Senior Product Manager to create a system for A/B testing. 
Ran 50+ software releases during a period in which Seatwave sales grow nearly 500%. 
Frequently presented new ideas and potential changes to the site.

companies.name: ABT
companies.blurb:
Designed and built a suite of online applications for the creation and maintenance of a fixed odds betting book on behalf of the first independent bookmaker in Italy. 
The suite of tools comprised a data input console, liability monitoring, accounting tools and a web site intended for use within a walled garden. 
Worked closely with the client throughout the product life-cycle from the creation of a requirements list, technical specification and during the evolution of the product, through to delivery. 
Designed and implemented a sports betting information site and bespoke CMS which was subsequently sold to a third party.

companies.name: Victor Chandler
companies.blurb: Acted as an intermediary consultant between VC and a major affiliate in Greece. Assessed the APIs and other tools used by VC and recommended how best the affiliate could extend the system for their own needs without compromising VC's internal guidelines or tying up too many resources.

companies.name: Betfair
companies.blurb:
Betfair asked me to build an interface for one of their main clients using the Betfair XML API. 
The application enabled the client to lay and bet, maintain a local version of activity and monitor their liability. 
The business logic was written in C# and JavaScript and aggregate data from the feeds was stored locally in an SQL DB.
